questions.question: When combining independent weak signals, a good practice is to:
options: Weight by historical predictive power and penalize collinearity
Give all signals equal weight always
Randomly choose one signal per day
questions.explanation: Historical lift and correlation control prevent double-counting noise.

questions.question: Compute weighted score: HMM=0.6 (w=0.5), Patterns=0.4 (w=0.3), Volume=0.5 (w=0.2). What is the combined score?
Explain why correlated signals should not be simply summed.
questions.answer_text: They may reflect the same information; summing inflates edge and over-sizes positions.
